trans-unit.source: Contains event data for the <xref href="System.Web.Compilation.ClientBuildManager.AppDomainShutdown"></xref> event and the <xref href="System.Web.Compilation.ClientBuildManager.AppDomainUnloaded"></xref> event.

When an <xref:System.AppDomain> instance is shut down or unloaded, an <xref:System.Web.Compilation.ClientBuildManager.AppDomainShutdown> event or an <xref:System.Web.Compilation.ClientBuildManager.AppDomainUnloaded> event is raised, respectively.
The <xref:System.Web.Compilation.BuildManagerHostUnloadEventArgs> object stores the reason for the shutdown or unload and is passed to the event handler as one of its parameters.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.Compilation.BuildManagerHostUnloadEventArgs"></xref> class.

This constructor creates a new instance of <xref:System.Web.Compilation.BuildManagerHostUnloadEventArgs> with the <xref:System.Web.Compilation.BuildManagerHostUnloadEventArgs.Reason%2A> property set to `reason`.
The reason for the hosted application domain shutdown.
Gets the reason the hosted application domain was shut down.

The <xref:System.Web.Compilation.BuildManagerHostUnloadEventArgs.Reason%2A> property stores an <xref:System.Web.ApplicationShutdownReason> object as its value that describes why the <xref:System.AppDomain> instance was shut down.
